page.title: 01Grantown on Spey
page.content: One of the most interesting and important of Scotland's many{18th {Century planned towns,}Grantown has a long history as an attractive{holiday {resort. It was{founded}in{1765}by{Sir James {Grant of Grant.}The "Good Sir James" was not only one of the most popular clan chiefs in the Highlands, but also one of the "improving" landowners in Scotland. In the{19th Century,}Grantown became increasingly famous as a Highland tourist centre, especially after{Queen Victoria}published a complimentary account of her{"very {amusing and never to be forgotten" {visit to the town in 1860. Visitors came to enjoy the charm of the planned town, the beauty of the pine forests, the sparkling Spey and the mountains ranged around.
